verses.kjv: Come, and let us return unto the LORD: for he hath torn, and he will heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up.
verses.web: “Come! Let’s return to LORD; for he has torn us to pieces, and he will heal us; he has injured us, and he will bind up our wounds.
verses.ct: "Come, let's return to the LORD! He's the one who tore us apart, but he will heal us. He struck us down, but he will bandage our wounds.

verses.kjv: After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up, and we shall live in his sight.
verses.web: After two days he will revive us. On the third day he will raise us up, and we will live before him.
verses.ct: After 2 days he will revive us. On the 3rd day he will raise us up, and we will live in his presence.

verses.kjv: Then shall we know, if we follow on to know the LORD: his going forth is prepared as the morning; and he shall come unto us as the rain, as the latter and former rain unto the earth.
verses.web: Let’s acknowledge LORD. Let’s press on to know LORD. As surely as the sun rises, LORD will appear. He will come to us like the rain, like the spring rain that waters the earth.”
verses.ct: Let's pursue knowing the LORD and never stop. His arrival is as certain as the sunrise. He will come to us like the rain — like the spring and autumn rains that water the earth."

verses.kjv: O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your goodness is as a morning cloud, and as the early dew it goeth away.
verses.web: “Ephraim, what shall I do to you? Judah, what shall I do to you? For your love is like a morning cloud, and like the dew that disappears early.
verses.ct: "Ephraim, what am I supposed to do with you? Judah, what am I supposed to do with you? Your loyalty is like a morning fog — like early dew that vanishes as soon as the sun comes up.

verses.kjv: Therefore have I hewed them by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: and thy judgments are as the light that goeth forth.
verses.web: Therefore I have cut them to pieces with the prophets; I killed them with the words of my mouth. Your judgments are like a flash of lightning.
verses.ct: That's why I cut them down through my prophets. I killed them with the words of my mouth. My judgments flash out like lightning.

verses.kjv: For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
verses.web: For I desire mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
verses.ct: I want mercy, not sacrifice. I want people to know God more than I want burnt offerings.

verses.kjv: But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.
verses.web: But they, like Adam, have broken the covenant. They were unfaithful to me, there.
verses.ct: But like Adam, they broke the covenant. Right there, they betrayed me.

verses.kjv: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, and is polluted with blood.
verses.web: Gilead is a city of those who work iniquity; it is stained with blood.
verses.ct: Gilead is a city full of people who do evil — its streets are stained with blood.

verses.kjv: And as troops of robbers wait for a man, so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.
verses.web: As gangs of robbers wait to ambush a man, so the company of priests murder on the path toward Shechem, committing shameful crimes.
verses.ct: Like gangs of robbers lying in ambush for a traveler, bands of priests commit murder along the road to Shechem. They carry out shameful crimes.

verses.kjv: I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
verses.web: In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing. There is prostitution in Ephraim. Israel is defiled.
verses.ct: I have seen something horrible in the house of Israel. Ephraim has given itself to prostitution, and Israel is defiled.

verses.kjv: Also, O Judah, he hath set an harvest for thee, when I returned the captivity of my people.
verses.web: “Also, Judah, there is a harvest appointed for you, when I restore the fortunes of my people.
verses.ct: As for you, Judah — a harvest of judgment is coming for you too, when I restore the fortunes of my people."
